noun.description: A person whose business is the disposal of dead or unwanted animals, especially those whose flesh is not fit for human consumption.

origin: Late 16th century (originally denoting a harness-maker, then a slaughterer of horses): possibly from obsolete knack trinket. The word also had the sense old worn-out horse (late 18th century). knacker (sense 2 of the noun) may be from dialect knacker castanet, from obsolete knack make a sharp abrupt noise, of imitative origin. It is unclear whether the verb represents a figurative use of slaughter, from knacker (sense 1 of the noun), or of castrate, from knacker (sense 2 of the noun).
